The 2010 season for began in January with the Tour Down Under and ended in
October at the Giro di Lombardia. As a UCI ProTour team, they were automatically
invited and obliged to send a squad to every event in the ProTour. The team's
general manager is Bob Stapleton, in his third year with the team.

With the team's focus shifting to full-time support of prolific sprinter Mark
Cavendish, many riders left the team after the 2009 season, most for the new .
Several young riders, most of them in their first year at this level of the
sport, joined the team to be members of Cavendish's new leadout train, which
will lack Cavendish's primary leadout man from 2009, Mark Renshaw, for the
first several months of the season due to Epstein-Barr virus. {{cite web
|author=Cycling News |url=http://www.cyclingnews.com/news/renshaws-absence-forces-columbia-to-
shuffle-cavendishs-lead-out-train |title=Renshaw's absence forces Columbia to
shuffle Cavendish's lead-out train |date=2009-12-24 |publisher=Cycling News
|accessdate=2009-12-27
| archiveurl= http://web.archive.org/web/20100127040027/http://www.cyclingnews.-
| com/news/renshaws-absence-forces-columbia-to-shuffle-cavendishs-lead-out-
| train| archivedate= 27 January 2010 | deadurl= no}}
| Cavendish's own training and development were also stunted because of a dental
| infection.
